test_input: Create an Instagram post about neural networks for beginners. Make it visually appealing and educational.

response.visual_description: A clean, educational Instagram graphic featuring a friendly, colorful illustration of a simplified neural network. Layered nodes are arranged from left to right, connected by glowing lines to represent data flow. Each node layer is labeled: Input, Hidden, Output. Soft gradient circles and playful iconography (lightbulbs, gears, brain) decorate the background, making the concept approachable. The overall mood is bright, modern, and welcoming—ideal for curious beginners.

color_palette.name: Vivid Coral
color_palette.usage: Accent nodes, icons, and call-to-action elements

color_palette.name: Soft Lavender
color_palette.usage: Secondary text and subtle node fills

color_palette.name: Clean White
color_palette.usage: Primary text, labels, and line elements

typography.style_notes: Headline at 36pt, uppercase, tight letter-spacing. Body text at 18pt, centered, with generous line-height. Use coral for emphasis keywords in body text.

layout.structure: Centered vertical stack: headline at top, neural network illustration in middle third, explanatory text and labels below, hashtags and CTA at the bottom. All elements centered and symmetrical.
layout.focal_point: The colorful neural network diagram in the center of the graphic
layout.visual_flow: Eye starts at the bold headline, flows down to the network diagram, reads the labels left-to-right, then drops to the CTA and hashtags at the bottom.

copy_suggestions.headline: Neural Networks Made Simple
copy_suggestions.subheadline: Your Friendly Guide to How AI Learns
copy_suggestions.body_text: Neural networks mimic the human brain to process data, learn patterns, and make predictions. It all starts with layers of connected nodes!
copy_suggestions.call_to_action: Save This & Start Your AI Journey

design_tips: Use subtle drop shadows and glows on the neural network nodes to give them a 3D, tactile feel that draws attention.
Animate the connections between nodes if posting as a Reel or Story for added engagement.
Keep the diagram simplified—no more than 3 layers with 3-4 nodes each—to maintain clarity for beginners.

field_types.color_palette: array of {name: string, hex: string, usage: string}
field_types.typography: object {headline_font: string, body_font: string, style_notes: string}
field_types.layout: object {structure: string, focal_point: string, visual_flow: string}
field_types.platform_specs: object {platform: string, dimensions: string, aspect_ratio: string, file_format: string, max_file_size: string}
field_types.copy_suggestions: object {headline: string, subheadline: string, body_text: string, call_to_action: string, hashtags: string[]}
